title: A great place to stay!
text: We stayed here as a family. The rooms were comfortable, clean and air conditioned. Nothing was too much for the staff who were both friendly and helpful. I also felt safe which was great in a backpackers. The location is perfect with the beach and restaurants basically at your doorstep. I highly recommend this accomodation.

title: Beautiful scenery, great experience
text:
Great tour with beautiful scenery and moderate fitness required for canoeing 5km.
Funny, friendly and informative tour guide.
Good tour for all ages.

title: Child held against her will
text:
My tween went to purchase a small bag of candy that came to the insane amount of around 40 euro!! she did not have this much money. When she explained this he told her she could not put it back and she must pay even though she had explained she did not have the money. She stood there for a long time scared and eventually snuck away and left.
This is against the law and this fool should be fired. Very creepy person.

title: Incredible look at ancient history
text: Self done tour, no lines in winter. Cheap also. Amazing to see the art of ancient history, stone carvings and be educated on how things were made in those times. Also enjoyed the ancient village the museum is built on top of. This needs to be seen along with the Acropolis in my opinion.

title: I guess it’s cool.
text: If you like history then you’ll probably enjoy this. I think it means more to the Thessaloniki people than it does to the tourists but it is still pretty cool

title: A Must See!
text: It is truly a spectacular site to see ancient remnants of once magnificent temples. To consider what it would have taken to make them in those times is hard to fathom. The views are also spectacular. You would be crazy to come to Athens and not visit this site.

title: Stunning scenery, healing spa but bad massage
text: The natural thermal spa is amazing. It does not take long to feel sublimely relaxed and the scenery is beautiful. Staff are slightly bossy as to where to place your things. To the point that it goes a bit far. The massage was terrible and I do not recommend it. Lovely snacks and drinks available.

title: Amazing staff, amazing views!!
text:
I loved our experience here.
The staff are amazing. The gentleman in the lounge 32 looked after us and was fantastic.
The rooms are clean and lovely.
Maybe a little small and dated for the price but there are other things that make up for it for eg.
The view of Oprah house, Sydney harbour bridge and city is amazing. We also watched the fireworks over the harbour from our bed!
The food in the lounge and drink selection was fantastic... both breakfast and canapés and sweets.
We totally loved it here.

title: DONT USE MENU ON FRIDGE!!
text:
Do not use the room service menu mantra provides through a company called gourmet deliveries
The food arrived cold!
Pizza looked like it had been dropped with topping falling of some of the pizza.
Receipt that was requested for work re-imbursememt was not given.
We called the company who told us they would check out what happened and call us back.
They never did!
Mantra if you are going to provide a service utilising another company then make sure they are not ripping people off.
Otherwise it takes your rating down.
Terrible room service experience and clearly the company not bothering to call us back suggests to me they do this a bit to customers.
This wrecked our stay at your hotel.

title: Beautiful food!
text:
This restaurant is worth the visit!
Beautiful food, very talented Chefs.
Very affordable if you go on a week night.
We paid $60 for a three course meal.
The wait staff are lovely and go above and beyond to make your night special.
Our family celebrated our sons 18th there.
We left so full!
Great night.

title: Amazing history!
text:
I really enjoyed all the ruins.
The details in the some of the survived ruins is pretty amazing and the views over the city are spectacular.
You can read about the history as you move throughout it or hire a device that tells you about it that you can listen to.
Honestly it's a very unique place

title: Natural, beautiful and unique
text:
This place is so worth the trip!
Natural hot springs filled with minerals that are so good for your skin.
It's hot just like a bath and the surrounding scenery is beautiful!
We did not see the other hot springs in the area to compare but we chose this was one because of it being in natural surroundings.
I suggest you bring a picnic and some wine because I wish we did however, there is a little local eatery with great pizza and pasta.
Enjoy!

title: Yummy and owner cares about his customers
text:
Super yummy pizza.
Rustic surroundings.
The owner saw that we didn't like something on our pizza and quickly wished it away making it just how we liked it.
We didn't complain he was just so attentive he noticed it wasn't right for us.
Lovely family run business.
Lovely food!

title: Quality for chesp
text:
We just needed a room for overnight as we were coming in at 1:30am.
This hotel was cheap as chips for the room quality.
Clean. Reasonable bathroom.
Comfortable bed.
Breakfast was very basic but honestly who would complain at 30 euro per night!
Lovely staff!

title: Best pasta of my entire life!
text:
If you go to Pula you MUST go to this restaurant!
I had as an entree shared with my husband, a creamy truffle pasta.
Honestly it was the nicest pasta I've ever had!
This is really saying something because my favourite food in the world is ravioli so I've tried so many pastas especially all over Italy.
It shocked me to taste the most amazing in Croatia!
It was home made and so light.
I'm kicking myself for not taking a picture!!!!
The main meals were beautiful and everything so filling.
The waiter was great!
He quickly suggested a appetito of grappa and bluberries as it was a common Croatian before dinner drink.
Great suggestion and I had two ;)
Honestly, do have a meal here you will not regret it.

title: Great history!
text:
What I really loved about this place is that it is not commercialised like many other similar historical structures over Europe.
Yes, you pay a reasonable fee to enter but i have visited in April and it felt like we had it almost to ourselves.
I love that you can see the pots and old kept tools etc. under the amphitheater without them being behind glass.
I enjoyed it.

title: Disappointed
text:
Wow!
I could not believe how dissapointed I was in Venice (Venezia).
I had looked so forward to this place and it was stinky like dog pee, fish and stinky waters.
There were so many crooks trying to rip you off and many restaurants did not offer authentic food.
For eg. Packet made ravioli and gnocchi.
In one shop I asked for wifi and the guy picked up my phone from me and turned on my data roaming... yes seriously!! Shonky donkey people!
I travelled all over Italy and these people were the rudest and untrustworthy of all my experiences. Do yourself a favour, give it a miss or spend one day there... in and out!

title: Great food and learning
text:
The chef taught us how to cook a traditional Greek meal.
The food was fantastic and so was learning to cook certain Greek foods properly.
I loved the experience.
Corfu Greece is great already but this added authenticity to the experience.

title: Romantic and perfect
text:
This is one amazing hotel!
Such a beautiful place.
Everything from the food to the room was lovely.
There heart clearly is to make your stay as perfect as possible.
The scenery surrounding is just as beautiful.

title: Interesting
text:
I love the beautiful sculptures and the history is very interesting.
Would highly recommend.
Some of the statues are not for the faint hearted but they are essentially very much part of the history and a little eye opening.

title: Great clean hotel
text:
This is a great clean hotel with friendly and helpful staff.
It's probably about a 3 star but if you are wanting a good clean hotel at a reasonable price then this place is value for money.
The reception were also amazing at explaining the bus that is only a 20 minute drive by bus to Venice.

title: Leaning tower unique.. worth it!
text:
Sure worth a trip.
The buildings are amazing and the leaning tower is quite an experience to walk up.
Wear good shoes as the steps are worn from age and tourists.
The security is also very high there also.
You can also visit the church and baptistery in the same area.
Great little touristy markets surrounding also.
At the top of the tower you get to see the city and hear the bells ring.
Pretty cool actually.

title: Wow! Loved it.
text:
This was our intro to Italy as we just arrived that late evening.
The reception were great.
Comfortable bed, beautiful garden scenery outside and the breakfast rocked!
Who doesn't love chocolate to go on their breaky ;) ha ha
We loved the place and the only reason I'm not giving it a 5 is because our shower was blocked ... but seriously it didn't matter that much.
A Great place to stay!

title: Peaceful, beautiful
text:
This was a relaxing a beautiful place to stay.
The rooms are basic.
The breakfast is basic but the property is to die for.
The rooms are very clean.
The owners are such beautiful people and absolutely helpful in ever way they could.
They also do transfers to the city which was convenient.
The property has so much potential.
Our only negatives was the shower was blocked which we had at another place in Italy too and the towel rack fell off.
Water in the shower didn't get hot enough and the towel rack fell off... oops!
Still worth staying... no regrets!

title: Stingiest McDonald in Australia
text:
After travelling halfway around Australia this was the only mcdonalds that would not give us iced water in a cup with the meals we paid for.
Just saying!

title: Great country hotel
text:
Lovely staff, very clean.
Perfect to get a real feel for charters towers with close access to both the town and the many tourist sites.
If your looking for a clean, affordable country hotel then this place is great!

title: Crazy!!
text:
The guy at the food counter is as crazy as anything!!
He yelled at me for not wanting beetroot on my burger!
Went on a rant that if I didn't speak quick enough to order he couldn't afford to put someone else on or something.
We went back to the car and I burst into tears.
Probably one of the nastiest people I've met in a long time.
I'ts a shame because it's a pretty authentic older styled drive in.
Pretty sue this guy is scaring his own customers away though.

title: Worth it!! Educational, fun :)
text:
This was so worth it!
Affordable, interesting and lots to look at. So much history collected in one place.
My girls learned to pan for gold by the owner who is a wonderful character and personalises the whole tour.
They were even able to take some home.
Overall a great afternoon!!

title: Hmmm ok...
text:
Paid $40 for breakfast, myself and two girls.
Frappes rocked but the eggs Benedict had a whole ham steak which was a shock and totally gross to me.
I don't know... I think the menu needs to say giant ham steak and eggs Benedict.
Girls toasters were fine.
Nice historical atmosphere but quite warm.

title: Wonderful!
text:
Everyone was as helpful and informative as possible.
They helped us take some fun pics too as well as to watch an informative video about the town and its history. Plenty of brochures and info to read too.

title: Pizza issues
text:
Usually we love Norfolk.
Locals for 8 years!
Two days ago be bought their takeaway pizza.
I arrived on time and our pizzas were ready but some non gentleman in the line that ordered his food decided to let all his mates in ahead of us waiting in the line and the lady at the register just let it happen.
After 20 mins!! Of their ordering and changing their minds, I think a few drinkies they had had were slowing the process down immensely!
Anyhow we finally got to pay for and pick up our pizza. It was greasy. The pizza box was wet and full of oil.
Probably from sitting too long. We threw it out.
Could I suggest a pizza line if you guys want to do takeaway. It's only between 5-6.
People do not like eating soggy, wet, cool food. After it waiting around for 20 mins.
The time before we ordered. We ordered three varieties of pizza and arrived home to fine 2 pizzas were the same.
I'm kind of giving up here.
The quality is slipping.

title: Like old school camp cabins...YUK!
text:
My husband and I brought one if the vouchers last year. When we looked at the website it doesn't really show you the yucky cabin you are going to get so be warned!!
There are nicer more expensive cabins at this property but when we asked if we could pay for an upgrade it was already booked.
Our kitchen cupboards and windows were filthy. The couch so small as well as the tiny ancient tv. The spa bathroom is dark and actually a little bit scary not romantic. Bed uncomfortable. Horrible experience felt so ripped off. Sadly the lady who runs it is very lovely but without truthful advertisement I felt disappointed in her. We managed one night there and although we had paid too we left a night early.
She really needs to consider more accurate advertising because after bringing my parents all the way up from Victoria to get our first get away from our children as a couple in over a year at the time.
We felt stolen from! Don't go here unless you get their high end cabin!!
Grateful I believe in karma
